answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Understand your predicament. There appears to be a multiple vessel disease. Depending on the viable myocardium present and the scoring pattern during cardiac catheterization, therapy is planned. Also, the present clinical symptoms and other co morbid conditions like diabetes need to be considered for therapy. So, please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Dear medhelp'i have recently bee diagnosed with'left ventricle/minor inferiorhypokinesis'overall mild impairment of the left ventricular function. Left anterior decending/severe deffuse desease from the mid vessel. Left circumflex, severe desease in the first obtuse marginal and a side branch thereof with some desease in the av circumflex/ right conary artery' dominant with moderate diffuse desease. These are symptoms diagnosed after having an angiogram two years ago. I am 59 3stone over weight don't smoke or drink, l have recently started a dieting like 40years to late. I am on medication which has helped the condition,but I'm looking for as much advise and help I can get. My email is . I hope you don't mind me contacting you. I hope to hear from you very soon. Many thanks. Ashley
title: moderate3 vessel desease
